etymologies: late Middle English: from an ewt (ewt from Old English efeta: see eft), interpreted (by wrong division) as a newt

definitions: a small slender-bodied amphibian with lungs and a well-developed tail, typically spending its adult life on land and returning to water to breed.

notes.text: Notophthalmus, Taricha, and other genera, family Salamandridae: numerous species, including the red-spotted newt (N. viridescens viridescens) of eastern North America and the rough-skinned newt (T. granulosa) of the Pacific coast from southern Alaska to northern California

shortDefinitions: small slender-bodied amphibian with lungs and well-developed tail
